title: The Adventures of Frank Flores: The Assisting Avenger

story.text: In the bustling city of Metroville, Frank Flores discovers a mysterious glowing stone while presenting at a tech conference. This stone grants him the power to multiply his presence, allowing him to assist multiple people simultaneously.

Frank decides to use his new abilities to help the city. He assists in a traffic jam on Main street, resolving conflicts and directing cars, all while simultaneously helping his neighbor assemble furniture.
Noticing the increased criminal activities, Frank uses his powers to be both on stage giving motivational speeches to youth and patrolling the streets, preventing crimes before they happen.

His double life begins to take a toll on him. Even with his powers, Frank starts feeling the strain of being everywhere at once. Today, he narrowly saves a child from a falling construction beam but feels his energy waning.

The city celebrates Frank as a hero; he is invited to give a TED Talk about the importance of community assistance and the power of technology in modern heroics. He's everywhere - helping, saving, and inspiring.
During the weekend, Frank reflects on his responsibility and limits. He decides to train others on using technology to assist more effectively, thereby not just multiplying himself but his impact.
Frank launches a nonprofit called 'Multipresence Matters', turning his week of solo superhero actions into a movement for community involvement and proactive assistance.

ending: Thus, Frank Flores learned that true power lies not just in being a hero, but in creating many.
moral: Leadership is about making others better as a result of your presence and making sure that impact lasts in your absence.
